CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 27, 1962, pg. 4 reads: "Prince Hall Shriners Plan Confab - Prince Hall Shriners will hold their 62nd national convention in Pittsburgh, beginning Aug. 18, 1963. Officials of the fraternal group met in a three-day session in Steel City recently and mapped elaborate plans for what is expected to be the largest convention in many years.  Attending the meeting, in the Penn-Sheraton Hotel, were, left to right, seated: Waynard H. Jones of Detroit, Mich., convention director; M.C. Martin, Danville, Va., treasurer; Atty. Genoa S. Washington, Chicago, Ill., Imperial Potentate; Thomas F. Poag, Winston-Salem, N.C., Deputy Imperial Potentate, and Booker T. Alexander, Detroit, recorder.  Standing: Henry M. Baysmore, Philadelphia, Pa., M.W. Grand Master, Prince Hall Lodge of Pennsylvania; Harry J. Keen, Pittsburgh, 1963 co-chairman of the convention committee; Marshall S. Johnson, Pittsburgh, 1963 convention coordinator, and John R. Bradford, Pittsburgh, 1963 convention committee secretary. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of twenty-two Prince Hall Shriner members, including from left, seated: Henry M. Baysmore, Waynard H. Jones, M.C. Martin, Atty. Genoa S. Washington, Thomas F. Poag, Booker T. Alexander, and Marshall Johnson; standing including Harry J. Keen, fifth from left, and John R. Bradford, fourth from right, gathered around table planning convention in Penn Sheraton Hotel
